rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you. See [[WP:FIXNF]] and [[WP:10CR]]
rev.diff:
Line 7: Line 7:
==Generation Wave activism and arrest==
==Generation Wave activism and arrest==
â
[[File:Generation Wave logo.jpg|thumb|250px|left|Generation Wave logo]]
 
Zayar Thaw is one of four founding members of [[Generation Wave]], a youth movement opposed to the [[State Peace and Development Council]], Burma's military rulers.<ref name="Irrawaddy"/> The group was founded on 9 October 2007, following the anti-government protests popularly known as the [[Saffron Revolution]], and used graffiti and pamphlets to spread pro-democracy messsages.<ref name="Irrawaddy"/> Zayar Thaw reportedly developed one of the group's more widespread campaigns, bumper stickers reading "Change New Government" to apply to cars carrying "CNG" stickers (for "compressed natural gas").<ref name="Irrawaddy"/> The group also circulated anti-government films, including [[Rambo IV]],<ref name="AAPP"/> in which the titular character battles [[Tatmadaw]] (Burmese military) soldiers in [[Karen State]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.burmacampaign.org.uk/index.php/news-and-reports/news-stories/Rambo-Draws-World-Attention-to-Forgotten-Crisis-in-Burma |title=Rambo Draws Worldâs Attention to Forgotten Crisis in Burma |author= |date=12 Feb 2008 |work= |publisher=Burma Campaign UK |accessdate=7 May 2011}}</ref> The film had been banned by the government for portraying the SPDC and its soldiers in a negative light.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1579082/Banned-Rambo-film-hot-property-in-Burma.html |title=Banned Rambo film hot property in Burma |author=Thomas Bell |date=18 February 2008 |work= |publisher=''The Telegraph'' |accessdate=7 May 2011}}</ref>
Zayar Thaw is one of four founding members of [[Generation Wave]], a youth movement opposed to the [[State Peace and Development Council]], Burma's military rulers.<ref name="Irrawaddy"/> The group was founded on 9 October 2007, following the anti-government protests popularly known as the [[Saffron Revolution]], and used graffiti and pamphlets to spread pro-democracy messsages.<ref name="Irrawaddy"/> Zayar Thaw reportedly developed one of the group's more widespread campaigns, bumper stickers reading "Change New Government" to apply to cars carrying "CNG" stickers (for "compressed natural gas").<ref name="Irrawaddy"/> The group also circulated anti-government films, including [[Rambo IV]],<ref name="AAPP"/> in which the titular character battles [[Tatmadaw]] (Burmese military) soldiers in [[Karen State]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.burmacampaign.org.uk/index.php/news-and-reports/news-stories/Rambo-Draws-World-Attention-to-Forgotten-Crisis-in-Burma |title=Rambo Draws Worldâs Attention to Forgotten Crisis in Burma |author= |date=12 Feb 2008 |work= |publisher=Burma Campaign UK |accessdate=7 May 2011}}</ref> The film had been banned by the government for portraying the SPDC and its soldiers in a negative light.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1579082/Banned-Rambo-film-hot-property-in-Burma.html |title=Banned Rambo film hot property in Burma |author=Thomas Bell |date=18 February 2008 |work= |publisher=''The Telegraph'' |accessdate=7 May 2011}}</ref>
